title: How to deal with toxic teammates?
body: So I just got out of what might be the absolute worst game of league I've ever been in in terms of toxicity. We're talking radioactive fallout levels here. Lead in the drinking water, "somebody poisoned the water hole" stuff. Normally I try to ignore this stuff, not let it affect me. But I'm ashamed to say this time I snapped and fired back. I threw all their vitriol back at them and then some. It felt good at the time, but now I feel just kind of scummy and frankly if these jerks try to report ME now they might have a foothold to do get a real punishment going, even though this is the first time I've ever done something like this. So I have to ask, for the future: how do YOU deal with toxic players? Any relaxation tips or thought processes that might help me (or others) from losing their cool in the future?

replies.body: You just mute them. Press tab, and there is a sound icon next to them on the scoreboard. Click it and you'll no longer see anything they type. If you don't, you're suffering for no reason, and if you respond in a negative manner you just open yourself up to being reported.

Mute them, then feed them.  Spend time in their lane and help them.  Toxic is really just fear and insecurity, and frustration.  If you can bolster someone's confidence, this will help them get over their frustration.

But don't forget the mute part.  If you type back or try to explain yourself, your "teammate" will spend the whole 20 minutes before ff explaining why you suck, why it's not his fault, etc. etc. . . and typing is not farming, and no farm = lose.

Use it at the beginning of EVERY game.  It will make you 10x happier playing this game.
AFKing is the only way to actually deal with them.

The only way to deal with ANYTHING in League is to play your ass off and try to win.  Maybe the guy's having a bad day.  Maybe he got dumped on last game.  Whatever, we all get tilted sometimes.

My trick whilst playing is simply not being tilted by losing, or self tilting by winning.

Play for mastery. Play for fun.
If you yourself are progressing further in the game, it doesn't matter what your team is doing.

Winning is definitely enjoyable.
However you will learn more through losing.
Find a way to enjoy your teammates saltiness, realizing that they are here to have fun and learn too.

You have pushed past the saltiness.
They will learn to do so as well.

You've learned most of your lesson, and if you feel "scummy" for being toxic, then this is a great learning experience for you as well.

Keep your chin up.
Your doing fine. 

:)

Problem is I don't progress further in the game and even enjoy my time when I have to deal with these people. It's not tilting to work up a nice lead, do everything possible to help the struggling lanes and then lose horrifically because they'd rather blame everything on you than admit anything is wrong with their gameplay. I'm so sick of it it's not even funny anymore. I don't like cowering behind my nexus turrets trying to salvage anything out of the game because my team ran str8 down mid into 1v5's and had no wards, no positioning, no semblance of what to do and it's all "ok"... they're just having a bad game...

Don't get mired into the endless pit of what if's.

Your not always going to be matched with a good team.
Your not always going to be winning your lane.
Your not always going to be making the winning plays.

What if mid lane didn't feed those 4 kills in the beginning?
What if jungle had ganked twice more?
What if bot had taken their tower instead of flaming?
What if .. What if there were no salty players?

In the end, we are in the game to have fun.
Look at each negative question & statement differently. Turn each statement positive.
Ask yourself what you can personally improve if you can't turn each statement positive.


Going with your quote,
If your team is rushing down mid aimlessly, why not be pro-active and ask them to place down wards, or push bottom lane.

If the team has no leader, it's just 5 people playing by themselves, trying to win by themselves and asking why their team-mates are "being stupid." for lack of a non-negative term.

Take initiative!
If you feel you are winning lane early, take the time to help notice your struggling team-mates.
Become the leader your team needs. Direct them.
Nobody is feeding intentionally.
You, me, your allies, we all came into the game to play the game and enjoy ourselves.

It is very rare that a person is there to intentionally feed the other team. Very rare.

I wish I could go on, but really it comes from inside.
You need to set your mind to helping your team.
If one team-mate is dead-set on feeding, and flaming, post positive thoughts, and strengthen your other team-mates.
Encouragement from a single team-mate will often have other team-mates backing the encouragement, and will stifle the toxic player for awhile.

At that point you've already become the leader.
Use your judgement.
Direct your team to victory, or as close as humanly possible.

Your positivity, your encouragement, your initiative, your drive to succeed, your willingness to hold your team together.
These are all boon's of a great leader.

Leaders aren't chosen by those of us who step forward.
Leaders are chosen because we refused to step back.

Cheers,

Xikini

It's unfortunate that you've been mired in multiple forms of defeat, however lashing out at others only hurts yourself.

I understand that my opinions may differ from your previous experiences but I feel that your letting anger cloud your judgement.
If you are unwilling to relent that there is a possibility that you yourself are not contributing to your losses, and are unwilling to follow through with improving yourself, then it's very likely you are simply feeling stressed at the current situation you find yourself in.

I strongly suggest taking a full day, even two days to simply relax.
Stare at the ceiling, pull out a book you used to love.

There's no need to force yourself to stare at a screen all day.
If you don't give yourself time to relax, by yourself, your simply going to wind yourself up further until you simply explode on someone and regret it in the future.

Take the initiative.
Take the advice.

I understand you want to lean on your team-mates, as they are currently leaning on you.
This is what a team is. Nobody is perfect. We lean on each other for support for a reason.

Embrace your inner child and let loose.

And please remember, I really am taking time out of my life to try to help you.
I'm not an infinite fountain of rainbow coloured optimism either, but I've been feeling quite well today.

I hope you have good cheer in the following days.

Xikini

Without knowing more of your specific circumstances I cannot give you direct advice.
Constructive & Helpful advice requires additional knowledge.
The best I can do is give you general advice in one small area of game-play to help you get further ranks.

Of course my advice is for players who are legitimately being held back by less skilled or knowledgeable players.

In the event that you fall under the less skilled or knowledgeable category, it's likely that my advice is not suited for you as of yet. If this is the case, my best advice would be to train for mastery of your champions before you will be able to lead a team of players to victory.

On the other hand 'toxic players' will not be able to gain much insight from my advice at all, as it is inherently backwards logic for these individuals. 'Toxic players' also tend to be in denial about being a 'toxic player'. A conundrum for someone of much superior knowledge to tackle.

Of course, my advice was directed and worded towards OP's current situation. Not towards you.
If you join another person's thread, and read advice for their current skill level, and it does not make sense to you, it's likely your skill level is not high enough to understand the complexity of the situation, and how to benefit from it.

In either case,

Cheers.

Xikini

Mute them.  They don't know what they are saying, maybe they had a bad day. I don't like to admit it, but even I become a bit toxic when the game isn't going well.  However, if you have pity on them and do not want to mute them, or talk back, the best option is kindness. Ask them if they are having a bad day, or if they are feeling well. In fact, one player has been very toxic in my game, and I asked if they are feeling okay. What was the persons response?

Their grandmother died that day. 

Toxic players are humans too, they need sympathy. They sometimes are players that need attention. although we can try to get them banned, we can also let them change.

I also want to talk about enemy toxic players. Almost everyone may have met a person saying in chat, report (blah blah blah) toxic. you can just say ok and report the certain toxic player they were talking about, or just not do anything, most toxic players will be banned someday anyway. and in my first suggestion in muting. you can report the toxic teammate too, your choice.

i simply dont say anything to them. i play my way and they play theirs. i leave chat up so that if they decide to harass and name call or try to get others to gang report me i can report them afterwards. as we all know flaming in chat is more likely to result in a punishment than simply trolling or inting.

Mute everyone and try ur best and only use helpful info in chat. I carried a pretty much 4v5 game cuz our lucian got butthurt started calling people names and would only push lanes wouldnt hit towers or help teammates still carried because I got extremely fed won 4v5's and eventually after 40 min he got bored and split push ended the game.
